data.title: automatic closing quote feature should be more intelligent
data.body:
When I type a single quote on a line in a Ruby file (for instance), Atom adds a closing quote right after it. This is useful in many situations but if I don't need that closing quote there, its tedious to remove it. If I hit backspace to remove the first quote (the one closest to my cursor), it removes both quotes, instead of just the one I want to remove. Again this could be expected behavior in some scenarios, but if I do this operation a 2nd time, it would be nice for Atom to recognize my intent to just remove the one quote. 

I feel that other editors do this automatically, but thats based on my muscle memory and I can't give you an example of one at the moment.

data.title: Hardware acceleration can actually be slower on Windows
data.body:
Depending on the environment and whether the machine's video card sucks, Atom's performance can actually be improved by unchecking "Use Hardware Acceleration". 

It'd be a good idea at some point to get a video card blacklist going where the default value of "Use Hardware Acceleration" is informed by this data point. You can fetch the video card Vendor/DeviceID via `wmic`.

A shorter term thing would be to update the copy below the option to note that it might help to uncheck it

data.title: Add grouped undo for all text editor commands
data.body:
This shouldn't be merged yet because it depends on [an unreleased text-buffer branch](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/36). Just wanted to get feedback on this approach.

Per a conversation with @kevinsawicki, I avoided changing the behavior of the `TextEditor`'s existing programmatic API. Callers can opt-in to undo-grouping using `TextEditor::withGroupingInterval`.

I updated the listeners for all editor commands and for the `textInput` event to use this method.

Closes #1606

data.title: Keyboard shortcut to open folder on Windows
data.body:
Added a keyboard shortcut for the "Open folder" action found in the file menu, based on the behaviour in the Linux version of Atom: Ctrl + Shift + O. Also logical because the keyboard shortcut for the secondary saving option (save as) is set to the original shortcut plus Shift.

PRed after discussion in [this thread at discuss.atom.io](https://discuss.atom.io/t/keyboard-shortcut-to-open-folder-on-windows/13080?u=jpelgrom).

data.title: Pass $PATH by command line
data.body:
On Yosemite the `$PATH` is not inherited by the `open` command, so we have to explicitly pass it by command line to make `atom` command inherit the `PATH` environment variable.

Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/issues/550.
